Exosomes are extracellular vesicles that carry cellular components, including nucleic acids, proteins, lipids, and metabolites . We elaborate on the changes with the non-coding RNA transcriptome .

Exosomes are carried and transported in blood and lymph, and serve near- and long-distance intercellular communication and biological effects . They also serve as a biomarker based on their contents, which may be altered in different conditions and physiological states .

These symptoms result from changes occurring at the molecular level from SARS-CoV-2 infection . A large autopsy study investigating multiple organs showed that the cellular and functional gene signatures from each organ’s major cell types (e.g., cardiomyocytes in the heart) decrease as a function of the viral load .

SARS-CoV-2 has also been suggested to dysregulate type 1 interferon signaling, which contributes to immune evasion early in infection . The immune system includes the innate and adaptive immune systems .

Neurological and psychiatric symptoms have been reported for acute, post-acute, and longer-term SARS-CoV-2 infection in human patients across the human lifespan . Neurological manifestations remain incompletely characterized in terms of etiology, severity, and incidence .

The spectrum of presumed virogenic psychiatric disorders across age cohorts and other demographic classifications is broad and includes anxiety, depression, confusion or disordered thought . Areas caudal to the neocortex tend to be most affected, with olfactory cortex, basal ganglia, hippocampus, amygdala, cerebellum, and brain stem abnormalities occurring in greater frequency and magnitude in COVID-
Many individuals recover from SARS-CoV-2, but a significant number of patients continue to suffer with long-term disease symptoms (e.g., PASC) long term after recovery .
